title.narrative: 2021 Life-saving emergency livelihood response in South Sudan

description.narrative: The project will provide life-saving livelihood support to a total of 180,000 People (30,000 households) in locations facing Famine Likely food insecurity (IPC 5). The expected impact is to protect food insecure households from hunger, malnutrition and destitution. The engagement will focus on rapid provision of emergency livelihood kits including crop and vegetable seeds, fishing kits and agriculture hand tools to ensure that vulnerable households will be able to engage in agriculture production during 2021 main planting season. The project will be based on the Integrated Rapid Needs Assessments already conducted. The available inputs in FAO warehouses will be distributed by FAO’s Implementing Partners operating on the ground in the first 2-3 months of project duration. In order to act quickly, FAO will advance the provision of inputs from existing stock and replenish the pipeline using CERF funds. The procurement of inputs for replenishment will take up to five months. To speed up process, FAO will use the same suppliers by repeating order, which will allow for swift procurement, fast transportation and delivery, and allow to avoid issues with customs clearances This project will establish synergies with other sectors by ensuring targeting of beneficiaries engaged for food distribution by WFP and organizations providing other support.
